result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

08:29 AM Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Steven P Dixon in court with attorney Pablo Galaviz.  

Wisconsin State Patrol Trooper David Heinisch sworn in and testified on direct by Attorney Campbell.
Cross examination by Attorney Galaviz.
Redirect by Attorney Campbell.

The State rests and moves for bind over based upon the officers testimony.
Attorney Galaviz provides closing arguments and moves to dismiss.

Court places findings on the record.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:27 AM Defendant Steven P Dixon in court, in custody, with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court is in receipt of Attorney Sonderhouse's motion to withdraw as counsel.  The defendant confirms he is seeking new counsel and his counsel intends on coming to see him in the jail today.  The Court will grant the motion to withdraw.  The Court will set this matter over for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Bail remains as fixed.
